questions.text: Who is the main character of the movie 'Airplane!'?
questions.explanation:
Ted Striker.

	He was a pilot in the war.

questions.text: Which meal was poisoned, the fish or the steak?
questions.explanation:
Fish & The Fish.

	'Yes, I remember. I had lasagna.'

questions.text: Why does one passenger suspect that Leslie Nielsen's character might be a doctor?
questions.explanation:
He is wearing a stethoscope.

	Dr. Rumack is sitting in his airplane seat wearing a stethoscope. This is the only sign that he might be a doctor.

questions.text: What is Leslie Nielsen's character named?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Rumack

	'Surely you can't be serious!' 'I'm very serious. And don't call me Shirley.'

questions.text: What basketball player plays the copilot?
questions.explanation:
Kareem Abdul-Jabbar.

	'Hey! I know you! You're Kareem Abdul-Jabbar, you play basketball for the Los Angeles Lakers!' 'I'm sorry, I think you have me confused with someone else, my name is Roger Murdock.' 'You are Kareem! I've seen you play! My dad's got season tickets.' 'I think it's time to go back to your seat, right Clarence?' 'No, let him stay. He's not bothering anyone.' 'I think you're the greatest, but my dad says you don't work hard enough on defense.' 'THE HELL I DON'T! Look, I'm out there bustin' my butt EVERY NIGHT. Tell your old man to drag Walton or Lanier up and down the court for 48 minutes!"

questions.text: Lt. Hurwitz suffers from extreme shell-shock. Who does he think he is?
questions.explanation:
Ethel Merman & Merman.

	The character of Lt. Hurwitz is actually played by Ethel Merman.

questions.text: What is the name of the inflatable automatic pilot?
questions.explanation:
Otto Pilot & Otto.

	And introducing Otto as himself, in the credits.

questions.text: Which actor plays Steve McCroskey at Chicago air control?
questions.explanation:
Lloyd Bridges.

	All the other choices were in the movie.

questions.text: A number of people commit suicide or die while listening to which character?
questions.explanation:
Ted.

	The third guy covers himself with gasoline and is about to blow himself up, but then Ted has to go to the cockpit. The guy blows out his lighted match with relief, then drops it. It's still hot so he blows up. He didn't ACTUALLY commit suicide, you see.

questions.text: 'What do you make of this?' 'This? Well, I could make a hat or a brooch or a _____________________.'
questions.explanation:
Pterodactyl.

	This exchange occurs when a worker at the airport shows Johnny, another worker, the newspaper. Johnny is one of the funniest characters.
